channel.title: Server
channel.description:
First of all, this is not a moparscape question.
Now. I'm connected to the internet in this way :
[my computer]-----[brothers computer]-----[internet]
(I'm connected to my brothers computer which is connected to the internet)
every time i host any type of server, apache and such, nothing can connect. I'm guessing its because we both have the same IP, and since hes connected to internet and I'm connected to him, any connections to our IP will think hes hosting the server, and connect to his computer not mine. this makes me mad because in my my programming learning i cant test things that require a server to be running.
how would i make it connect to my computer instead of his?

item.title: Server
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

how about instead of your pc>hispc>router>modem>internet, you go
your pc
>router>modem>internet
his pc

Read full topic

item.title: Server
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

i assume you are usin windows, select the network connection for the router and the network connection for your computer, then right click > bridge

Read full topic

item.title: Server
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

Plug your computer into the router instead of your brothers computer, and change the settings for it to work if appropriate.

Read full topic

item.title: Server
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

we have a router, how would i bridge the connections?

Read full topic

item.title: Server
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

u need to bridge the connections, but you need a router or it wont work
